page.topic: Add Alternative Login to Current User

section.description: Add account credentials for an alternative login provider such as Google.

This action is used with the UX component. Alternative logins allow users to login to an application through a different account; such as a Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, or Twitter account. When an 'Add Alternative Login to Current User' action is defined, in addition to an authentication provider a list is also required. If you add a login for a different provider it this list control will be updated to show the change. For more on how to implement this action follow the guide below or watch this video on '[Adding Alternative Logins to a UX Component]'. The action is described about 4 minutes into the video. This video is part 4 of a 5 part series about alternative logins: [Part 1], [Part 2], [Part 3], [Part 4], [Part 5].

section.title: Using the 'Add Alternative Login to Current User' action.
section.description: There are a number of steps that must be taken before it is possible to add an alternative login to a UX component.

section.title: Set up a Provider on a External Site
section.description: You can use many different sites for a provider, this example will use Google. Because these are external sites the actual means of setting up a providor is prone to change.

step.description: Open the 'Credentials' page in the API Manager
From the 'Create credentials' menu select OAuth client ID.
From the Application type list select 'Web application' and click Create.
You will recieve a Client ID and a Client Secret.

section.title: Create a Named Provider in Alpha Anywhere

step.description: In Alpha Anywhere's Web Project Controls panel open click the 'Project Properties' button.
Scroll down the properties list to the 'Resource Providers' section. Click the [...] button next to the 'Named Providers' property.
In the Configure Named Resource Providers dialog click the 'New' button.
Set the 'Resource Name' to be 'Google Test'.
Select the 'Google(OAuth)' option from the 'Provider' dropdown.
Paste the Client Id from that you recieved from Google into the 'Client Id:' textbox.
Paste the Client Secret that you recieved from Google into the 'Client Secret:' textbox. Click OK
In the Web Projects Control Panel click on the 'Web Security' button in the main toolbar.
Select 'Web Security Configuration' and click OK.

section.description: There are a number of options in configuring web security to include Alternative Logins.

section.title: Add an Alternative Login to a UX Component

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Data Controls' menu. Click on [Textbox] to add a textbox control to the component. Give the textbox the name and label of 'username'
In the Data Controls menu click on the [Textbox] option again to add a second textbox to the component. Name and label this textbox control as 'password'.
Highlight the password control in the controls tree. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click on the [Button] option to add a button to the component.
